. Why would he want such a compromised spokesman? Was he naive enough to believe Mr Andy Coulson 's assurances? Or did he not care about what had taken place? Neither scenario is very comforting." I think that Mr Andy Coulson has much more explaining to do. I am amazed that Dave did not think this too, and that he, in the wake of what I know he was advised by very senior colleagues, persisted in having this deeply compromised man in the heart of No 10. This is catastrophic for Dave, whose arrogance, lack of judgment and contempt for decent values are all exposed at a stroke by Andy Coulson 's scuttling off with his head held low. The Times argues- perhaps unsurprisingly, as like the News of the World it is owned by Rupert Murdoch - that Andy Coulson 's departure will not seriously damage the prime minister and has far less political sigificance than Alan Johnson

Business Video: Spacey, Moore tackle financial crisis at Berlin film fest Report Abuse Easy solution, change the tax codes on bonuses. Make a sliding scale starting at say 20% on bonuses of$ 2000 or more, up to say 45% for bonuses over 100K and say 75% for bonuses over one million dollars. Actual numbers would need more consideration for an even distribution. Tax all stock options at the highest value of the stock in the past 5 years so that people can't load up on tanking shares that will rebound to maybe 3X their issue value.

I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night," Zahi Hawass , chairperson of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said on Saturday. Egyptian citizens tried to prevent them and were joined by the tourism police, but some( looters) managed to enter from above and they destroyed two of the mummies, he said.
